list: Ability to apply knowledge of mathematics, science and engineering techniques in biological systems with an understanding of working mechanisms and recent advancements.
Ability to analyze problems involving biological systems using principles of science, engineering and mathematics.
Ability to design and conduct experiments, interpret and analyze data to provide solutions in bioengineering.
Knowledge and exposure to laboratory techniques, biomedical/process equipment, and computational tools for analyzing biological systems.
Expertise in handling modern equipment and computational tools for prediction and analysis of complex bioengineering problems.
Ability to assess health-related, legal and cultural issues and contribute to medical sectors in society.
Techniques to tackle pollution and contribute to sustainable development.
Understanding of ethical issues in biological sciences and bioengineering and ability to apply professional ethics.
Ability to function as both an individual and as part of a team in multi-disciplinary settings.
Ability to communicate efficiently with society through reports, documentation, and presentations.
Ability to apply engineering and management principles to manage projects in multi-disciplinary environments.
Impetus for lifelong learning in the context of technological changes.
Impart knowledge about applications of engineering techniques in biological systems.
Attain knowledge and expertise to work efficiently in biotechnological, biochemical and biomedical industries.
Prepare students to pursue higher studies in bioengineering.
Develop capabilities to work in research and development organizations.
Learn protocols and employ engineering principles to solve industry-relevant bioengineering problems.
Learn to design and develop equipment, experiments, and computational approaches in bioengineering.
